ambusher.description: Ambushers are melee warriors who can slip by beefier heroes to get to squishier targets in the back lines.
ambusher.label: Ambusher

artillery.description: Artillery creatures fight best from afar and have high range on their most powerful abilities.
artillery.label: Artillery

boss.description: Boss creatures are powerful commanders who often serve as villains at the climax of adventures. They often aid allies like a leader with much better Stamina and damage output.
boss.label: Boss

brute.description: Brutes are hardy creatures who have lots of health and deal lots of damage. They have abilities and traits that make them difficult to ignore and hard to get away from and that push enemies around.
brute.label: Brute

controller.description: Controllers are creatures who change the battlefield, often with magic or psionics. They reposition foes and change terrain to make it more advantageous for their allies. They tend to be on the squishier side, so they need some protection!
controller.label: Controller

defender.description: Defenders are tough creatures able to take a lot of damage and force enemies to attack them in lieu of squishier targets. Defenders often act in squads with allies who have lower Stamina, like controllers and hexers.
defender.label: Defender

harrier.description: Harriers are mobile warriors who use hit-and-run tactics in combat. Their traits allow them to make the most of their position.
harrier.label: Harrier

hexer.description: Hexers specialize in debuffing enemies with conditions and other effects. They also tend to be a little squishier.
hexer.label: Hexer

support.description: Support creatures aid their allies, providing buffs, healing, movement, or action options.
support.label: Support

mount.description: Mounts are mobile creatures made to be ridden in combat. They make their riders even more dangerous. Mounts act at the same time as their riders
mount.label: Mount

solo.description: A solo creature is an action-oriented creature who can take on the player characters on their own or with just a handful of underlings.
solo.label: Solo

agility.label: Agility
agility.description: Agility (AGL) represents coordination and nimbleness. A creature's ability to backflip out of danger, shoot a crossbow, dodge an explosion, or pluck keys from a guard's belt is determined by Agility.

intuition.label: Intuition
intuition.description: Intuition (INU) represents instincts and experience. A creature's ability to hear the approach of a distant rider, figure out the tell of a bluffing gambler, calm a rearing horse, or track a monster across the tundra is determined by Intuition.

might.label: Might
might.description: Might (MGT) represents strength and brawn. A creature's ability to break down doors, swing an axe, stand up during an earthquake, or hurl an ally across a chasm is determined by Might.

presence.label: Presence
presence.description: Presence (PRS) represents force of personality. A creature's ability to lie to a judge, convince a crowd to join a revolution, impress a queen at a royal banquet, or cast a magic spell by singing a song is determined by Presence.

reason.label: Reason
reason.description: Reason (REA) represents a logical mind and education. A creature's ability to solve a puzzle that unlocks a door, recall lore about necromancy, decipher a coded message, or blast a foe with psionic power is determined by Reason.

doubleBane.label: Tier decreased by 1 due to double bane

doubleEdge.label: Tier increased by 1 due to double edge

combat.markTurnTaken: Mark Turn Taken: Decrement Turns Left By 1

dazed.label: Dazed
dazed.description: While you are dazed, you can take only a maneuver or an action on your turn, but not both. You also can’t use triggered actions or free maneuvers.

frightened.label: Frightened
frightened.description: If you are frightened, attacks you make against the source of your fear suffer 1 bane. If that source is a creature, any attacks they make against you gain 1 boon.

grappled.label: Grappled
grappled.description:
While you are grappled, your speed is 0 and the speed of the creature grappling you is halved. When a creature grappling you moves, they can bring you with them. If a creature has you grappled by physical means, you move with that creature if they are force moved, and they move with you if you are force moved. See Break Grappled in Maneuvers for more information on ending this condition.
If a creature is grappling you with magic or by some other nonphysical means, the condition ends if they don’t have line of effect to you. If you teleport while grappled, the condition ends.
Unless otherwise noted, a creature can grapple only one other creature at a time.

prone.label: Prone
prone.description:
While you are prone, attacks you make suffer 1 bane, and melee attacks made against you gain 1 boon. Enemies can move through your space without needing to make an Acrobatics test. You must crawl to move along the ground, which costs you 1 extra square of movement for every square you crawl.
You can stand up from prone by spending 2 squares of movement when you use a maneuver, an action, or an ability that allows you to move.

restrained.label: Restrained
restrained.description: While restrained, your speed is 0, attacks you make suffer 1 bane, and attacks made against you gain 1 boon. You can’t be force moved unless the effect making you restrained says otherwise. If you teleport while restrained, the condition ends. See Break Restrained in Maneuvers for more information on ending this condition.

slowed.label: Slowed
slowed.description: While you are slowed, your speed is halved (rounded down as usual).

surprised.label: Surprised
surprised.description: While you are surprised, attacks against you have 1 boon and you can’t use triggered actions.

taunted.label: Taunted
taunted.description: If you are taunted, you suffer 2 banes on attacks that don’t include a creature who taunted you, and you can’t willingly move away from a creature who taunted you while you have line of effect to them. If you gain the taunted condition while already taunted, the new condition replaces the old one.

unbalanced.label: Unbalanced
unbalanced.description: While your Health is 0 or lower, you are unbalanced. You can’t take the Recover action in combat, and whenever you make a test using a physical characteristic, make an attack, or use an action or a triggered action, you lose 5 Health.

unconscious.label: Unconscious
unconscious.description: If you are unconscious, you can’t take actions, maneuvers, or triggered actions, and you can’t undertake no-action activities. Additionally, your speed is 0, you are unaware of your surroundings, and you are prone. Attacks made against you gain 3 boons (including the boon from being prone).

weakened.label: Weakened
weakened.description: While you are weakened, your attacks and tests suffer 2 banes.

winded.label: Winded
winded.description: When your Health has been reduced to half your Health maximum or lower, you are bloodied. Although the bloodied condition has no effects on its own, certain ancestry, class, item, and title abilities affect bloodied creatures.

bleeding.label: Bleeding
bleeding.description: While you are bleeding, you can’t regain Stamina.

level.label: Stamina Gained at 2nd and Higher Levels

forgery.label: Forgery
forgery.use: Create false badges, documents, and other items

jewelry.label: Jewelry
jewelry.use: Create bracelets, crowns, rings, and other jewelry
